It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that resemble those of the poplar tree, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, arranged in clusters. Operculina populifolia is often found growing in moist, shaded areas such as forest undergrowth or near water sources.
